Articles.Content:
I just returned to the game, having not played it since 1.0.5, and installed a bunch of mods as I always do. However, none of the plugins seem to work. Scatterer, Firespitter, Kopernicus, EVE, Texturereplacer (at least I think so), etc. I'm pretty new to the x64 build, so I don't know if I need to do something different when modding. I mod manually, not using CKAN. Parts packs work fine, And the parts in those packs also work fine. But the plugins don't.

Any help would be appreciated.
hi are you using mods that are updated or old versions?, no plugins from pre 1.1 will work. If you have all updated mods, have you installed them correctly

18 minutes ago, SpannerMonkey(smce) said:

hi are you using mods that are updated or old versions?, no plugins from pre 1.1 will work. If you have all updated mods, have you installed them correctly

Will mods that aren't working break the game?

12 minutes ago, Moggiog said:

Will mods that aren't working break the game?

Yes, maybe not immediately,  but eventually, Though  I think most of the mods you listed have been updated so just update them, easy fix

Even though nothing obvious is happening a lot IS happening in the background, if a plugin loads but produces a lot of errors it will spam the log with errors , if you have a few mods doing this it wont be long before your game either crashes, corrupts a save or becomes so laggy/unstable that it's not worth playing

Edited June 11, 2016 by SpannerMonkey(smce)

14 hours ago, SpannerMonkey(smce) said:

Yes, maybe not immediately,  but eventually, Though  I think most of the mods you listed have been updated so just update them, easy fix

Even though nothing obvious is happening a lot IS happening in the background, if a plugin loads but produces a lot of errors it will spam the log with errors , if you have a few mods doing this it wont be long before your game either crashes, corrupts a save or becomes so laggy/unstable that it's not worth playing

I redownloaded all the mods when I installed them, they should be properly updated.
